intro: Geigeria zeyheri, commonly known as the yellow daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown disk flowers, which give it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Geigeria zeyheri is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
